remarks: The axiom of continuity.  Take two sets of points ` A ` and ` B ` .  If all the points in ` A ` come before the points of ` B ` on a line, then there is a point separating the two.  Axiom A11 of [Schwabhauser] p. 13.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 20-Jun-2013.)
statement:
axcont $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ ( A C_ ( EE ` N ) /\ B C_ ( EE ` N ) /\ E. a e. ( EE ` N ) A. x e. A A. y e. B x Btwn <. a , y >. ) ) -> E. b e. ( EE ` N ) A. x e. A A. y e. B b Btwn <. x , y >. ) $.
$d A a b x y $.
$d B a b x y $.
$d N a b x y $.
